ELEMENT.TITLE: Evolution (Web 2.0)
ELEMENT.SUMMARY:
This is the next generation Ajax theme. It offers:
  • Your choice of 6 colors.
  • Advanced search
    1. Prompts the customer with likely search phrases as they type. (must have dictionary catalog specified)
    2. Displays a list of the customers recently searched words.
    3. Displays search results within an ajax layer in the body of the page.
  • Gen2 minicart which keeps your customer on the product page when add to cart is pushed.
  • FORCES your product pages to a next generation ajax product layout.
    1. Product reviews (optional - requires CRM bundle)
    2. Ajax tell a friend (optional - requires XSELL bundle)
    3. Printer friendly version of page (it's seo friendly too)
    4. Description and specifications (detailed description)
    5. Accessories product list with ajax product info
    6. Related items product list (max of 3)
    7. On-hover effect for product images that loads larger version (still click to see original)
    8. Manufacturer, manufacturer's id and product id
    9. Retail price and 'a savings of'
    10. Support for WikiText
    11. Strips HTML from all product fields on product page (to ensure ajax compliance)
  • 468x60 linkable image element in the header.
  • Ajax login which only appears if customer is NOT logged in, otherwise it displays their username.
  • Newsletter subscription box
  • Optimized for high resolution monitors (1000 pixels wide).

ELEMENT.HELP: Choose a color from the list above to select the aesthetic to your store

The search catalog feature allows you to set which fields in the zoovy system are searchable. By default, DEFAULT is created and selected, which searches your product ID and name. You can create and modify search catalogs from the 'search catalogs' page off of setup. A 'dictionary' search is required for the text autocomplete feature. If you have questions, please schedule time with a trainer.

Search mode has three options:
  • 'and' which will do a search and return results for product with BOTH words that are searched (X and Y) - system default
  • 'or' which will do a search and return results for product with EITHER words that are searched (X or Y) - returns most results
  • 'exact' which will do a search and return results for product with exact word(s) that are searched - returns least results
    • If you have questions, please schedule time with a trainer.

ELEMENT.TRUE: Tell a Friend
ELEMENT.HELP:
Tell a Friend or TAF is a feature that puts a contact form on your product pages so that your customers can send product specific information directly to an associate of theirs. Your branding and product specific information are in the email sent, as well as a custom message set by your customer.
This feature requires the XSELL bundle.

Product Reviews allows your customers to add their personal input about a specific product. Once their review is submitted, it is entered into a queue for your approval. You have the ability to add/remove/edit any specific review through the product editor.
This feature requires the CRM bundle.

ELEMENT.HTML:

this element is skipped on non-secure pages. On secure pages, the sub is placed into the JS for the search to work properly
-->

ELEMENT.HELP:
WARNING: linking within your Zoovy store requires you to use a special syntax in order to avoid cart/cookie issues. When setting up links, use this variable to ensure the cart id is passed in the URL and that users don't bounce between domains.
Links should look like this: %CART%/category/cat.safe.name
Links should NOT look like this: http://yourdomain.com/c=54654SD6546SDF4656/category/cat.safe.name
The c= is the cart id. If you paste that in as your link, all your customers will share the same cart id. This would be bad.
If you have questions, schedule time with your trainer or contact support.

<script type="text/javascript" src="%GRAPHICS_URL%/jslib/scriptaculous-js-1.7.1/src/controls.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
<!--

var session_id = '%SESSION_ID%';
var store = '%STORENAME%';
var DOCID = '%WRAPPER_ID%';

function updateCart() {

	$('PUTCARTHERE').innerHTML = 'Updating - please wait!';
	new Effect.Highlight($('PUTCARTHERE'));
	
	// this gets called by handleResponse (which is in zoovy.js)
   var postBody = 'm=RenderElement&format=WRAPPER&docid='+DOCID+'&element=IMAGECART&targetDiv=PUTCARTHERE';
	new Ajax.Request('%MAGIC_URL%/ajax/RenderElement', { postBody: postBody, asynchronous: 1,
		onComplete: function(request){handleResponse(request.responseText);} }
		) ;
	}

//
// this function is overloaded, and is run whenever an "add_to_cart" button is clicked
//		it finds the form with a product id that matches on it.
//
function addToCart(id,pid) {
	// alert("adding To Cart (product: " + pid + ")");

   var postBody = 'm=AddToCart&cart='+session_id+'&pid='+pid;
	for (i = document.forms.length-1; i>=0; --i) {
		if (document.forms[i].elements['product_id']) {
			if (document.forms[i].elements['product_id'].value == pid) {
				postBody = postBody + '&' + Form.serialize(document.forms[i]);
			   new Ajax.Request('%MAGIC_URL%/ajax/AddToCart', { postBody: postBody, asynchronous: 1,
			      onComplete: function(request){handleResponse(request.responseText);} }
			      ) ;
				}
			}
		}
	// alert('finished with addToCart');	
	}

//--></script>
<script type="text/javascript" language="javascript">
<!-- 
/*
get the list of keywords and if present, display them. If not, forget about it...
If a word is searched, prepend it to the keyword variable separated by a pipe - | and save it back to the cart.
redisplay list of keywords with the newest word at the top, do NOT retrieve again from cart.
display the search results in appropriate div.
*/

var myKeywords = '%SEARCH_KEYWORDS%';
var session_id = '%SESSION_ID%';


//Set this var to the maximum number of results you want shown in the recent searches.
var maxWords = 6;

/* ##### this is the master function to display the updated list of keywords and the search results.
1. look to see if myKeywords has a value.
  	if so: append myKeywords to the new word as update var.
 		if no: set new word to update var.
2. update CART with the list of keywords.
3. Update display of keywords with latest edition.
4. Load the search results into the magically appearing div.
*/

function updateKeywordList(newWord) {
//if myKeywords isn't blank, postpend them onto value, separated by a pipe.
	if(myKeywords != '')
		var update = newWord+'|'+myKeywords;
	else
		var update = newWord;

//Set the postbody var.
	var postBody = 'm=set&data='+update+'&src=CART::SEARCH_KEYWORDLIST&cart=%SESSION_ID%';
//Update the cart with the pipe separated list of keywords.
//onComplete, load the results of the new Word and update the list of keywords that are displayed.
	new Ajax.Request('%MAGIC_URL%/ajax/set', { postBody: postBody, asynchronous: 1, onComplete: function(request){
		displayKeywords();
		loadResults(newWord);
	}});
	return update;
	}

/*	##### This functions will update the recent searches div. It reloads a SCRIPT element.*/
function displayKeywords() {
	var postBody = 'm=RenderElement&format=WRAPPER&docid='+DOCID+'&element=RECENTSEARCHES&targetDiv=keywordsDisplay';
	new Ajax.Request('%MAGIC_URL%/ajax/RenderElement', { postBody: postBody, asynchronous: 1,
		onComplete: function(request){handleResponse(request.responseText);} }
		) ;
	
	}

/*  ##### THis function will load the results into a div. */

function loadResults(keywords){
// set text in div to let user know a search is being conducted.
	$("edresults").innerHTML = 'Searching, please wait...';
//if the results panel is already open, no need to open it again, just higlight it to let the user know something has changed.
	if($("edresultscontainer").style.display=="none") 
		Effect.SlideDown("edresultscontainer");
	else
		new Effect.Highlight($("edresultscontainer"));
		
	var postBody = 'm=RenderElement&AJAX=1&format=WRAPPER&docid='+DOCID+'&element=WRAPRESULTS&targetDiv=edresults&CATALOG=%CATALOG%&mode=%SEARCHMODE%&keywords='+keywords;
	new Ajax.Request('%MAGIC_URL%/ajax/RenderElement', { postBody: postBody, asynchronous: 1,
		onComplete: function(request){handleResponse(request.responseText);} }
		) ;
//	alert(postBody);
	}
//-->
</script>

</head>
